it is entirely understandable for individuals to choose to consume only organic and natural foods and avoid genetically modified foods. however, it is important to note that there is currently no scientific evidence to support the claim that genetically modified foods pose a long-term risk to human health. 

it is also worth noting that organic foods are not necessarily safer or more nutritious than genetically modified foods. organic farming faces their own potential risks, such as the risk of bacterial contamination or consumption of natural toxins.

it is ultimately up to individuals to make their own informed decisions regarding their food choices. however, it is vital to rely on scientific evidence to make these decisions instead of relying on personal beliefs or misinformation. if one is concerned, one option is to consult with a registered dietician or other health professionals to help make informed food choices.
